description:
4120 - Senior Business Intelligence Developer

Prime Team Partners is currently collaborating with a Washington based client to identify a Senior Business Intelligence Developer to join their steadily expanding Business Intelligence Development team. The team will be providing ongoing and ad-hoc Business Intelligence consulting services to client teams throughout the Puget Sound area working within a SQL Server environment. There will be a combination of large solution delivery projects where there will be an established Technical Project Manager leading the project, and ongoing opportunities for this senior member of the team to manage their own smaller ad hoc projects.

This team will be responsible for the delivery of
* Business Intelligence Tools and Solution Development (design, development, deployment)
* Providing Database Development, Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), SSIS, multidimensional cube development, and reporting and data visualizations for clients
* SQL Server Architecture and Development including storage, replication, server tuning, version upgrades, backup/restore, and security
* Multi-dimensional OLAP cubes using SSAS and MDX queries
* T-SQL development and Common Table Expressions (CTE), stored procedures, triggers, query tuning
* End-to-end Data Integration and ETL procedures

Responsibilities of the Business Intelligence Developer
* Demonstrate knowledge of Business Intelligence applications with a focus on SQL Server, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), OLAP, ROLAP, and HOLAP, MDX, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), DDL/DML
* Data modeling, Data Mapping, Data Warehouse Architecture, Business Intelligence Development, Project Management
* Collaborate with stakeholders, company leaders, and end users

Qualifications for the Senior Business Intelligence Developer
* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or the equivalent combination of training and professional experience
* Five Years in Developer, Programmer, Coder roles, with an established focus on Business Intelligence development using the Microsoft BI Stack (SQL Server, T-SQL, SSAS, OLAP, SSRS, SSIS, MDX, DAX)
* Experience in the design, development, and implementation of:
+ Data Warehouses (DW)/ Enterprise Data Warehouses (EDW)
+ Business Intelligence applications in relational and multi-dimensional environments (Cubes, SSAS, OLAP)
+ End user reports using SSRS

Attributes That We Are Looking For
* Desire to bring the possibilities of Business Intelligence to clients and their end users
* This is a client facing team and strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills are essential
* Interest in some technical project management and delivery management responsibilities

This is a full time, direct hire opportunity in Bellevue, Washington, part of the Greater Seattle area. The team is also considering individuals who are looking for opportunities in the Portland area. The compensation package will include a competitive base salary, and a comprehensive benefits package.

For immediate consideration, please send your resume to ashlea@primeteampartners.com. For information on additional opportunities currently available with Prime Team Partners, please explore our careers page of our website at www.primeteampartners.com

description:
Use your open source development skills to help clinical researchers cure disease and solve complex, big data problems. You will work with our product team in South Lake Union on our secure, web-based, data management platform in an Agile/scrum environment. Engage with clients to understand requirements, design solutions, and ensure a high quality product at all points during the development process. 

 

Ideal Candidate

This person has significant experience working with complex enterprise level systems, building customer facing web applications, and working in an agile/scrum environment. This person is highly proficient in Java (or C#) and open source technologies. This person will be comfortable working up and down the stack, have a passion for clean, concise code that is maintainable, and be able to learn new things quickly. This person is enthusiastic about collaborating with other team members to improve the development process and customer experience.

 

What We Do

Our team partners directly with leading biomedical researchers working to prevent and treat a wide range of diseases (HIV, cancer, diabetes, autoimmune diseases, asthma, allergies, and others); we learn their science and develop solutions to help them make sense of their data.  We are serious about developing high quality software, delivering innovative solutions, and contributing to the research community, but we're just as committed to maintaining a work environment where everyone has fun while solving hard problems.

 

Key Responsibilities

  • Work efficiently at all levels within a large, highly complex, existing open source code base
  • Interface with clients and translate client requests into general-purpose software solutions
  • Communicate clearly and consistently with clients on an ongoing basis including discussing technical concepts with non-technical stakeholders
  • Learn the bioinformatics science necessary to understand client data, methods, and work flows
  • Demonstrate genuine interest in doing meaningful work and contributing to/building a great product development team

 

Qualifications

In addition to a strong track record of working hard, taking ownership, and learning new technologies quickly, you should have:

 

  • A Bachelor's degree in computer science, bioinformatics, or equivalent
  • 5+ years of professional software development experience with a consistent track record of owning feature level deliverables
  • Strong object-oriented design and coding ability, including experience with object oriented languages: Java, C#, C++
  • Proven knowledge of web-based technologies (JavaScript/JavaScript Frameworks, jQuery, ExtJS, AngularJS, and HTML, CSS, JSP, AJAX)
  • Experience with web application development (Spring, Tomcat) and relational databases (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, etc.)
  • An understanding of modern software development techniques, including the full SDLC, object-oriented design, continuous integration, version control, and agile methodologies
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
  • Strong problem solving and decision making skills; comfortable with ambiguity
  • Experience solving bioinformatics problems (preferred)

 

Benefits

LabKey is a fantastic place to work with a cohesive team that enjoys working together. Our approach is scenario driven, user centered, and highly iterative. Our software team earns a 12 out of 12 score on the Joel Test (a twelve-question measure of the quality of a software team). Other benefits include medical, vision, life and LTD insurance, FSA, 401(k), bonus plan, and paid sick time.

 

About LabKey Software

LabKey Software solves complex, high-throughput data management problems for leading biomedical researchers. We build solutions tailored to our clients' needs by extending the secure, scalable, open-source LabKey Server platform for collaborative research. Our work benefits from and contributes to the open-source community, building an ever-more powerful and capable platform, available to everyone.

 

LabKey Software provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. For more information on LabKey Server please visit labkey.org and labkey.com.

 

How to Apply

Ready for a rewarding career where your work could improve people's lives and global health? Send your resume to devjobs@labkey.com. Principals only; we will not respond to recruiters.

description:
NAVIS is looking for a creative, motivated Software Engineer to join us as a critical member of our Engineering Team in beautiful Bend, Oregon.  

 

NAVIS is seeking highly-competent "development athletes" to join our team, rather than position players.  This means you know how to develop rich code, regardless of the tools you use - you are very capable and easily learn new technologies.  We are re-architecting many of our products from the UI through the database, and we are exploring (and soon will be choosing & implementing) new technologies to add to our existing technology stack, including the use of functional programming with Clojure and/orScala. The primary focus of this position is coding new, creative, operational software that enhances our products.  

 

It’s an exciting time to be at NAVIS!

 

This developer will design, develop, optimize and test client/server and web applications in an Agile / SCRUM setting primarily based on Open Source technologies. As part of the Engineering Team, you will collaborate closely with the Chief Technology Officer (CTO), Chief Innovation Officer (CIO), Technical Team Leads and other Product Team members, to design exceptional software / product solutions to meet customer needs.

 

If NEW software development is your passion, this position could be a great fit! The Engineering Team has multiple projects that often start at the concept stage and develops new products and/or product features from scratch. Our products are constantly evolving with our client needs - we are not simply maintaining existing products.

 

This is a full SDLC development position. The candidate must be willing to take on all aspects of the development process, and be ready to support applications in production environments. He/she may be asked to test code sets, document software, and implement products and related solutions. Strong knowledge of design patterns and software development best practices must be shown at all times. A high degree of creativity and motivation is required of the successful candidate, who is expected to operate with limited direct supervision. This developer needs to have a willingness to do whatever it takes to make the products and the company successful.

 

At NAVIS, we expect all our employees to live our Core Values:

  • Golden Rule: Treat others as you would want to be treated
  • Integrity: A person of your word, highly trusted
  • Innovation: Open and involved in creating or executing on "new"
  • Passion: Love the TEAM, the clients and the work we do
  • Attitude: Consistently display a positive, can-do attitude

 

ABOUT NAVIS:

Based in Bend, Oregon, NAVIS is the leading provider of sales and marketing solutions to hotels, resorts and vacation rental management companies in North America. Building on our rich 25-year heritage with humble beginnings, NAVIS is strategically focused on the critical value of providing accurate, timely data for our clients. Our clients view NAVIS as the best source of solutions, and employees view NAVIS as THE best place to work.

 

We are proud to have been named by the Oregonian as a "Top Place to Work in Oregon" three years running!

 

Also,  NAVIS was a finalist in the 2015 Oregon Tech Awards Technology Company of the Year!!  http://www.navisblog.com/navis-finalist-in-the-15-oregon-tech-awards-technology-company-of-the-year-growth/  

 

WHY WOULD YOU WANT TO WORK FOR NAVIS?

  • Our technology is blossoming and we will be utilizing some of the latest and greatest technologies on the market today, including functional programming.
  • NAVIS is growing fast due to high market demand for our products. Our products are successful because they truly help our clients succeed and grow. We demonstrate our value to our clients every single day.
  • We are building new technologies and enhancing existing ones - we are NOT standing still. We are re-architecting our products from the UI through the database. This means we need strong, creative, intelligent developers with great ideas that love to build awesome software products.
  • As stated above, The Oregonian has listed NAVIS as a "Top Place to Work in Oregon" in 2012, 2013, and 2014. We live the core values listed above - they are not window dressing.
  • Strong technical leadership in a team-based atmosphere
  • Your work matters; your impact will be visible
  • Local, established Oregon-founded and based company
  • Healthy financial foundation
  • We give generously to local charities and offer opportunities to participate to directly help those in need
  • Very competitive salaries with a 10% annual bonus target and a full benefits package, including matching 401(k)
  • You get to LIVE and WORK in Central Oregon - what could be better than that?

 

LOCATION OF THIS POSITION:

To foster a highly-collaborative team environment, this position will be located in beautiful Bend, Oregon.

 

Experience and Skills:

  • Experience with greenfield functional programming or functional software development or functional architecture is highly desired
  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience, bonus for an MS in Computer Science degree
  • 5 or more years of web software design & development experience on highly scalable web properties supporting multiple browsers
  • Strong knowledge and experience developing on multiple server-side frameworks, including and Open Source stack
  • Strong experience with Design Patterns
  • Database application design and development experience, preferably in a multi-tenant database environment. Experience with MySQL, MongoDB and Hadoop would be highly beneficial.
  • Solid understanding of software development life cycles
  • Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
  • Demonstrated expertise in Object-Oriented Analysis and Design, with a focus on high-quality, timely, and supportable and maintainable code delivery
  • Broad experience with iterative development with quick release cycles, such as Agile/SCRUM/TDD methodologies and associated tools
  • Full stack development experience is ideal

 

In addition to the above requirements, you should also have experience with the following:

  • Development experience in Clojure and/or Scala is highly desired
  • AngularJS, Backbone.js, Node.js, Linux, Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA), MySQL, Hadoop or MongoDB and similar NoSQL databases
  • Complex MySQL query design and troubleshooting
  • Experience with Cloud Computing and Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • Experience developing applications for international customers
  • Development experience with CRM and/or VOIP services is desirable

 

We also have a telephony-oriented role as a Software Engineer, which would include the following duties and requirements:

  • Collaborate with project team members to provide input to design specifications related to real-time call routing application
  • Develop IVR & call recording applications industry standard telephony switches
  • Integrate to backend systems such as web services, databases, SMS, CTI, and reporting
  • 5+ years experience in VoiceXML IVR technologies
  • Experience with Metaswitch development
  • SIP and TDM experience
  • Encryption and cyber-security experience

 

ABOUT BEND, OREGON:

Bend, the county seat of Deschutes County, covers 32 square miles. To the east is high desert vegetation and to the west, Bend is surrounded by U.S. Forest Service land. The city is noted for its scenic setting, mild climate, year-round recreation opportunities and growing economy. At an elevation of 3,625 feet, Bend enjoys the predominately dry climate of the Great Basin. Sunny days, cool nights and low humidity characterize the weather.

 Love the outdoors? 

 The following activities are all right out your doorstep (quite literally, in many cases):

  • Mountains, mountains, mountains: the Three Sisters (Faith, Hope and Charity), Broken Top, and Mount Bachelor are the five most prominent peaks nearby, and offer activities galore
  • Climbing: world class rock climbing is just 25 minutes north of Bend at Smith Rock
  • On the River: the Deschutes River flows right through the middle of town - people use it for kayaking, paddle boarding, floating the river, fishing, or simply walking its banks
  • Skiing: Mount Bachelor is just 25 minutes southwest of Bend, and there are other ski resorts nearby offering Alpine and Nordic skiing at all skill levels – snowshoeing, too!
  • Mountain Biking: there are many miles of existing trails for all skill levels, and new trails currently under construction
  • Fishing & Boating: countless lakes, streams, rivers, ponds and reservoirs at your disposal
  • Hiking & Camping: dozens of designated campsites nearby with access to trails
  • Golfing: 20+ courses sit in the surrounding area
  • Whitewater Rafting: there are multiple guiding companies in the surrounding area
  • Hunting: bow or rifle hunting for deer, elk, bear, water fowl, etc.

 In addition to Bend's outdoor recreational ethos, there are now 13 (yes – 13, and counting) craft breweries in town! World-class craft beer is one of the cultural pillars of Bend - after a fun day at the slopes or on the river, a well-deserved beverage is a staple among we Bendites.

 Check out the Official Bend Oregon Video created by VisitBend.com for more information on the area:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u6zSKJqalug ;

description:
Please read this entire presentation about this Business Intelligence / Data Warehouse Developer career opportunity prior to applying.

 

Are you eligible to be considered for this position?

If you currently reside in the United States and you are eligible to work for any employer in the U.S. without the need of sponsorship now or in the future, then you are eligible to apply for this position. We are open to sponsor the visa for the eligible candidates or work with your current visa sponsoring company

 

Is our client’s environment and culture a fit for you?

The culture on this team is to provide the opportunity to be the ‘expert’ and to have autonomy in your work.

 

Our client’s values are….

  • Entrepreneurship
  • Technological Excellence
  • Reliability
  • Passion
  • Responsibility

 

Who is our client? A leading life-sciences research institution located East of Seattle is looking to hire a contract Senior ETL/BI Engineer. This group focuses on scientific research in fields including environmental analysis, pharmaceutical development and cellular research among others. They have grown significantly since their establishment over 50 years ago, are publically traded and continue to generate billions of dollars in revenue. This is an outstanding opportunity for an experienced Java engineer to join one of the leading scientific institutions in the area in a software development capacity.

 

Does this position align with what you want to do in your next role? Let’s find out….

Lead one or more simultaneous Data Warehouse projects for BI and data warehousing initiatives. This position requires leading an ETL team, create functional requirements and technical specifications as well as design, develop, test, document, implement, manage, and maintain solutions utilizing Informatics’ technology stack, including Informatica Power Center/Data Quality Tools and Teradata. Also work along with ETL/Data Analysts and EDW Architects in designing/enhancing ETL architecture. Perform hands on development and mappings using Informatica Power center. Responsibilities include full lifecycle project management, solution design, and overall ETL design and development.

 

What skills do you need to be successful in this position?

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.

 Strong understanding of data integration and ETL methodologies such as Informatica, and Teradata

5+ years of experience working in a high volume Informatica Power Center, Metadata Manager environment and 10+ years in ETL.

Strong knowledge in Different data base technologies like Oracle, SQL server

Experience in converting specifications to programs and data mapping in an ETL Informatica environment

8+ years’ experience with Oracle, SQL Server in UNIX environment.

Provide High Level and Low Level Architecture Solution/Design to the project

Strong expertise with PL/SQL and T-SQL, Experience writing complex SQL statements and analyzing SQL Tuning/performance is a must.

Excellent communication skills.

Excellent teamwork.

Outstanding analytical skills.

Excellent troubleshooting skills.

Ability to learn new or existing systems quickly

2+ years ETL Team Lead experience.

Recent Teradata knowledge / experience required

One or more Informatica toolset knowledge (Data Quality, MDM) - good to have

 

 

  

What will your title be?

Your title will be Business Intelligence / Data Warehouse Developer

CenturyLink Cloud (CLC) is the focal point for all cloud-related development inside the larger CenturyLink Corporation. Everyday millions of Amazon customers order online and create tons of packages for delivery. It is so natural for you that the package shows up at your doorway on the same day or next day. Amazon Transportation is the hero behind the scene. In Amazon Transportation, we are building the best delivery network on earth. To achieve this, we create a flexible set of building blocks that can be configured regionally achieving a fast, reliable and cost-effective network. By using our knowledge of customers and the contents of our shipments, we are creating a delivery experience that surpasses all others. Geographic technology (GeoTech) team develops global geo database and services for the transportation technical solution. The data and services are helping Amazon locate customer addresses to accurate geocodes, make promise to delivery commitment, plan the routes, navigate vehicles to right locations, help customers discover nearby self-pick points and many more. We develop technical solutions for efficient understanding of nature language to describe a location, employing crowd-sourcing to improve the data accuracy, and uncover the hidden value behind each delivery.

As we grow, we are looking for an engineer who is excited by the unique challenges this space provides, and who is able to think strategically as well as drive implementation. You will be building large distributed systems that are reliable, maintainable and scalable. You will get your hands dirty designing full-stack of software. description:
The Builder Tools organization within Amazon Web Services (AWS) at Amazon is looking for a Software Development Engineer to join our team of talented software engineers to work on Amazon's powerful distributed deployment systems, Apollo and AWS CodeDeploy.

You can find out more about our products by reading Amazon CTO, Werner Vogels', blog post:

http://www.allthingsdistributed.com/2014/11/apollo-amazon-deployment-engine.html

Our team owns the software and systems that help Amazon’s massive developer community build the cutting edge services and technology that Amazon is known for. Our systems make it possible for every developer at Amazon to rapidly change their running applications without ever having to jeopardize the availability our customers expect. We deliver the technology that powers fully automated deployments and dynamic fleet scaling for some of the worlds largest services, and we're not done yet! We are looking for developers who are passionate about making managing applications in the cloud work for everyone.

We own and build every aspect of our product, from the UI and external APIs down to the backend services and databases. We are solving problems in a new space, at a scale that far exceeds most companies on the planet. Want to see how Amazon builds software on its cloud computing infrastructure? Come join us and work on a foundational system that makes software change possible at a massive scale.

If you have what we’re looking for come join a strong team in a highly visible organization. You will have a significant impact on Amazon's massively distributed software development environment and help us to build the best continuous deployment and fleet management system in the world.
The Builder Tools team at Amazon.com is looking for a top-notch Software Engineer to help extend Apollo, Amazon's powerful distributed deployment system.

Our team owns the software and systems that help Amazon’s massive developer community turn revolutionary ideas into code running on production servers. Apollo make it possible for every developer at Amazon to rapidly change their running applications without ever having to take an outage. With a few mouse clicks, or a fully automated continuous deployment workflow, Amazon engineers can bring code changes and new features to the customer, or dynamically shape the size of their fleet all because of the magic we provide. Ever wondered how the amazon web site is available 24 hours a day yet it is continually evolving? Apollo is the answer.

Apollo is a at the core how engineers work at Amazon. Every engineer uses it every day. In Apollo, everything we do goes into production and is instantly used by tens of thousands of other engineers. What we do makes a difference.

We have so much more we want to do. Help us to write the next generation of systems that controls the software on millions of servers for thousands of applications while delivering on the promise of elastic capacity. We want to make it as easy as possible for application owners to create rapid change, and we need developers who are excited to make managing applications in the cloud work for everyone.

We own and build every aspect of our product, from the UI and external APIs down to the backend services and databases. We are solving problems in a space that has very little prior art, at a scale that far exceeds most companies on the planet. Want to see how Amazon builds software on its cloud computing infrastructure? Come join us and work on a foundational system that makes software change possible at a massive scale.

If you have what we’re looking for come join a strong team in a highly visible organization. You will have a significant impact on Amazon's massively distributed software development environment and help us to build the best continuous deployment and fleet management system in the world.
• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field, or 4+ year relevant work experience
• 1+ year experience with one modern programming language such as Java, Ruby, C++, or Perl

• Computer Science fundamentals in data structures
• Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis• Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers

description:
Inviso increases our clients’ bottom lines through a unique combination of Strategy and Operational Consulting, Business Intelligence and Marketing.  We help our clients develop and clarify their business strategies, dissect and analyze their business data, and create behavior-changing marketing solutions. We are an entrepreneurial, agile organization with a broad range of business experience and talents and a laser focus on adding value to our customers. We are headquartered in Bellevue, WA, with locations around the world.

 

Inviso is rapidly advancing is the areas of Windows 8 Modern UI style and mobile line of business applications and the solution integration with customer infrastructures.  In addition, we offer traditional BI solutions to our clients including web-based, cloud, and Big Data solutions.  Our projects range from smaller scale data-driven web-based applications to Enterprise scale applications requiring real-time high capacity data streaming and event management.  We are looking for a solution architect to join our rapidly growing Business Intelligence team and assist in solving a wide variety of new and exciting technical challenges.

 

The ideal candidate will be an expert in many categories.  They should have hands on experience with both Microsoft and non-Microsoft technologies, have been a technical leader in multiple projects, experienced with Software development Life Cycle methodologies (including Agile), and have performed a variety of roles in project life cycles. The job essentially entails performance of various responsibilities in the course of a project. The primary responsibility is the development of technical systems solutions in consultation with clients, program management, engineering, and operations.  This position involves describing the behavior and structure of a solution, describing the solution, and the process of delivering it. The job also involves ensuring timely delivering of solutions on projects; though this task is owned by project managers the solution architect shares in the responsibility.  The solution architect will report to and work with the Enterprise Architect to establish strategic direction in engineering processes and technologies for Inviso.

 

Job Duties

  • Investigate new technologies and make recommendations regarding appropriate usage
  • Create modeling diagrams such as system, data, infrastructure, etc.
  • Customer Engagement Management as a technical resource from pre-sales through deployment
  • Review requirements and functional specification documents for clarity, completeness, and implementation challenges
  • Investigate and design system solutions
  • Provide input to Account Management on estimates for statements
  • Create technical documentation
  • Contribute to technical reviews – by ensuring accuracy of design to requirements and implementation with regard to the design
  • Contribute to technical standards and process improvement efforts
  • Mentor others on architecture and design skills and concepts
  • Participate in test and production deployments

 

Key Qualities

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in a related field
  • Strong skills in problem solving, opportunity discovery, and team resolution
  • Mix of business and technical skills
  • Technical depth & breadth
  • Critical & creative thinking
  • Attention to Detail - Resolve ambiguous complexity into actionable details
  • Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Teamwork skills, Attention to Detail, Eagerness to learn, Strong work ethic

 

Required Qualifications·        

  • Ability to work directly with external clients and line of business application users
  • 10+ years developing software using relevant languages and Microsoft technologies
  • 6+ years designing integration between backend, services, and presentation layers of small- to large-sized applications
  • 3+ years architecting enterprise scale system solutions using .NET, C#, WCF, SOAP, REST, Visual Studio
  • Experience with XAML, XML, and LINQ
  • Cloud experience
  • Understanding of core relational database concepts such as normalization, relational integrity, & transaction management
  • Ability to work in large and small project teams in equally effective ways
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity and work effectively with limited supervision
  • Strong experience with traditional and agile software development life cycles.

 

Desired Qualifications

  • Experience consulting as a solutions architect to other companies
  • Experience designing and developing Windows 8 and mobile applications
  • Azure experience
  • Experience with Visual Studio Teamwork Foundation Services
  • Experience working with high data volume systems
  • Experience designing & developing business-to-business data exchange processes
  • Experience with html 5 and JavaScript
  • Microsoft work experience very helpful

description:

POSITION PURPOSE:

Responsible for designing, coding, unit testing and implementing high quality software for CHPW’s Enterprise Data Warehouse.

 

PRINCIPLE DUTIES:

Essential Functions:

  • Applies approved application development practices for the analysis, design, prototyping, development and unit testing of CHP applications primarily for usage in the Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) functions moving data and metadata into the Data Warehouse
  • Assists with the migration of existing applications from SQL Server to dimensional warehouse environments
  • Manages the extract processes from the dimensional warehouse environments to meet any regulatory requirements
  • Develops and tunes existing data warehouse applications to ensure optimal performance  
  • Unit tests application programs, identifies errors in program logic and verifies functionality and compliance with user specifications
  • Works with application development management to prepare estimates on design and development efforts
  • Leads and/or participates in design and code reviews
  • Communicates project status, design and other related issues to the appropriate management
  • Recommends changes in procedures or tools as required
  • Leads and provides technical direction to less experienced programmer/analysts
  • Updates and/or develops documentation for application and/or application development processes and procedures.
  • Encourages and enforces conformance with departmental and organizational standards by other staff
  • Contributes to design and architecture discussions
  • Coordinates the planning and implementation of new CHPW applications and features
  • Assigns and monitors work of Application Development staff as required
  • Provides application and operational support to the production operations and help desk teams
  • Works closely with CHPW architecture guidelines to ensure compliance with internal technical directives and strategic roadmaps
  • May serve as the Development Lead on Project Team(s)
  • Other duties as required

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education

 

  • Bachelor’s degree required in Computer Science, Math or Engineering and 4+ years of programming experience in custom application analysis, design and development and/or reporting; or 8 years of programming experience

 

Prior Related Experience

  • 2-5 years Microsoft BI Stack
  • Managed care health plan and/or health care industry experience preferred
  • 3+ years Microsoft SQL Server 2000/2005
  • 3+ years C# (.NET)
  • 2+ years UML design experience
  • 2+ years Web Services experience
  • 2+ years Weblogic and/or Microsoft IIS

nowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Understanding of how to automate data load processes using SSIS, and/or Informatica, Data Stage, Synopsis/ODI
  • Experience implementing monitoring processes to automate the detection and resolution of loading errors

Senior, Lead, Principal Engineer, Startup UI Team (Open Remote Locations) 

Relocation Offered for USA Residents ONLY. H1b transfers are welcome. Green Card Assistance available. 

Interested in working for what is considered to be the #1 most innovative company in Enterprise and Consumer Software? How about working for one of the top three (3) fastest growing companies in the world? We're one of the worlds largest and most successful 'cloud computing' technology (infrastructure and applications) companies and pioneered the multi-tenancy architecture long before Google, Microsoft or Amazon. We have one of the largest and most scalable cloud deployments in the industry (billions of daily transactions with 18ms of latency). 

We're perceived as being a series of smaller start-up companies under a larger umbrella, each having their own autonomy to innovate and deliver exciting new products and distributed services. We aren't afraid to pioneer and take chances in the industry as we believe innovation is important and is best for our customers and their need(s). 

Engineering culture is incredibly important, we encourage our Employees to take (1) one-week paid time off annually, in addition to their (3) weeks paid vacation, to work on personal technical projects from home -- go learn iOS programming, build your own Javascript Framework, whatever excites you, etc. 

Don't be concerned about getting bored. That's really no problem because we encourage our Engineers to move around from group to group. In fact, we have a policy that is meant to facilitate internal transfers to different groups without issue, interested in moving to Infrastructure, Core or Applications, no problem after each major release. We also informally review your performance every (3) three-months, which gives you a tremendous opportunity to move up the ranks whereas most companies only review every (12) months. 

Consider having a conversation with us. We'd be pleased to answer your questions about technical challenges, titles and responsibility, and compensation. Having this name on your resume will definitely open doors for you further down the road in your career. 

Records that our company set in 2014: 

- Hit record of 14.6B customer-facing transactions/month 

- Hit record of 206B underlying database transactions 

- Average response time of 225ms 

- 68% year-over-year growth in Object Count (32B) 

- 250 Patents filed (25% increase over highest number of patent filings per year) 

- 3 major releases & 526 total releases in FY14 


JOB DESCRIPTION

We are seeking developers with strengths in front-end, backend or full stack that are excited about building out complex capabilities and presenting them as simple and intuitive end-user experiences. You will work on our flagship point-click-drag-drop App Builder that will enable the creation of custom mobile-enabled fully responsive Apps. This App Builder is being launched as a simple yet powerful way for non-technical administrators, designers and professional developers to create applications and sites while leveraging our PaaS/Platform as a Service to deliver custom enterprise solutions and commercial applications distributed via the world's leading Enterprise Application Exchange. 

If building out complex capabilities and presenting them through intuitive design appeals to you, come talk to us!! 


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

** Write scalable, performant code that customers love. 

** Negotiate and honor cross-team agreements on architecture and delivery. 

** Take responsibility for your code and features from working with product management all the way through to deployment and support. 

** Analyze, design and develop test cases and implement automated functional and system test suites. 

** Value customer and team success over individual productivity. 

** Master our development process and culture, and then improve it. 

** Resolve complex technical issues in existing applications. 

** To continually learn, improve, and model good citizenship in the organization and code base. 


EXPERIENCE 

** The ideal candidate has experience building robust frameworks for authoring and delivering declarative web-based mobile enabled applications and derive joy from delivering their work to customers in tight, high-feedback cycles. This role is for an experienced software developer with a minimum of 5 yrs experience. 


REQUIRED EXPERIENCE

** Excellent server side programming skills in Java. 

** Strong front end HTML, CSS programming skills. 

** Exceptional JavaScript programming skills. 

** Knowledge of working with JavaScript frameworks to create rich interactive content. 

** Experience integrating with server-side code to produce dynamic pages. 

** Excitement about emerging web technologies such as HTML5 and CSS3.

** Developing cross-browser, cross-platform, cross-device compatible solutions. 

** Experience building high-volume production systems or commercial shrink-wrap software. 

** Experience with agile methodologies.

description:
About Us

Marketly is currently seeking a talented, self-starting, aspiring tech wiz for a full-time position in the Seattle Area. Here at Marketly we do real work for real customers (the paying kind), are rapidly expanding, and offer the promise of exciting new projects.

This is an opportunity to get involved in a hot market and join a highly respected company in the industry. We work directly with Fortune 50 companies to craft intelligent solutions to exceedingly difficult problems including piracy and counterfeit. By leveraging modern programming tools and practices, we are bringing an agile responsiveness and excellent customer support to our happy clients.

About You

You’re gonna need skills:

  • Familiarity with web application frameworks and REST APIs (preferably developing them). We use Ruby on Rails, but can appreciate many other RAD frameworks.

  • Front-end chops with the ability to breath life into a design with HTML (5), CSS (3), and JS (jQuery). Extra consideration for experience with a popular front-end framework.

  • Strong Object-Oriented fundamentals forged from working with a truly capable OOP language (C#, Ruby, python, Java).

  • Knowledge of relational database concepts and how to write custom queries. You do not need to be a DBA, but we do have some of those MySQL things.

If you’ve got it, props, if not, you’ll learn it soon enough:

  • Cloud, hybrid environments, and devops. Some exposure to infrastructure never hurt anyone: aws, linux admin (centos, ubuntu), vagrant, passenger, nginx, windows, azure. Points for a devops tool like chef, salt, or puppet.

  • Comfort with continuous integration, source control (git), and working on the edge. We work smartly fast and are always looking for new ways to stay sneaky quick.

  • Alternative (i.e. not SQL) structured data stores. Redis, neo4j, and RabbitMQ are in full effect.

  • Basic data analysis and custom reporting. We’ve got data on data and sometimes people want to see it not on a hard drive.

  • Tests. No, really.

Attributes and Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science preferred and 3-7 years of relevant experience with corresponding demonstration of agency and leadership. Time served in a startup environment is a huge plus.

  • Most excellent team practices. You must enjoy working with others and know how to help contribute in a variety of settings including brainstorming sessions and paired programming.

  • Comfortable with communication. Working in a small team means having to speak up more often than not, in email, on the phone, through Slack, and ye olde face-to-face.

  • Pride in playing out of position. You should be rarely rattled and enjoy maneuvering a multitude of technologies.

Why Bother?

We offer competitive salary, full benefits, and flexibile working environment.

Here you will work daily and directly with key decision makers and provide frequent tangible contributions to our core products and services. We offer an opportunity to cultivate expertise in full stack integration, high volume data analysis, and rapid application development. There is also significant ownership and management growth potential.

Why stifle yourself with office bureaucracy and layers of corporate ladders? This is an early-stage opportunity with a successful startup. We want your creative spirit, your wacky suggestions, and your unique brilliance. Join us and help build our innovative team, become a foundational member, and establish the future of our company culture.

description:
Founded in 1980, Seattle-based Precor is a subsidiary of Amer Sports Corporation (www.amersports.com), the world's largest sports equipment company, with internationally recognized brands that include Wilson, Atomic, Suunto, Salomon, Mavic and Arc'Teryx. For more than 30 years, Precor has been inspiring people to live a life in motion. Precor's world headquarters is located in Woodinville, WA with additional domestic operations in Whitsett, North Carolina. Precor is the #1 supplier of fitness equipment to many of the world's biggest fitness chains, including 24 Hour Fitness, Gold's Gym, Anytime Fitness, and YMCA. Precor is also a preferred fitness equipment supplier to Hilton Hotels worldwide. With a mission to be the standard of excellence in the fitness industry, Precor manufactures and sells high-end fitness equipment for the home and commercial environment.
  • Cardio Equipment (e.g. Ellipticals (EFX), Treadmills, Adaptive Motion Trainers (AMT), Bikes)
  • Strength Training Systems
  • Fitness Entertainment Products (e.g. Personal Viewing Screens (PVS), Audio Transmitters/Receivers)
Why You Should Join the Precor Team
  • Dynamic, forward thinking company leading the industry in product innovation
  • Rewards and recognition for superior performance
  • Collaborative environment fostering teamwork and accountability
  • Opportunity to work for a company that positively impacts people's lives
  • Exceptional benefits program including profit sharing, generous 401(k) match, and free on-site gym access
  • Superior employee discounts on Precor and other Amer Sports Corporation brand products

Come join us on the Preva Platform team to change the fitness industry through Networked Fitness. We are a small agile team building the web services and web sites that power Preva, the industry leader in Networked Fitness: http://www.precor.com/preva.
It?s still early days and you?ll be able to grow with us into the modern web user interface, scalability and big data challenges we are beginning to face. Your contribution in this area will make a tremendous impact on the product.


You will work with the latest technologies in a startup-like environment, using a low overhead process that is being continually refined. You will have the opportunity to work with other talented and passionate product development professionals and build strong, collaborative relationships in delivering an unrivaled user experience in the fitness industry.


We are looking for passionate engineers who care about the quality of their work and write clean, tested code because it?s faster to do it that way.


The ideal candidate has a passion for fitness and multiple years of industry experience in commercial product development with a good balance of front-end and middle-tier/database skills, and has the ability to effectively partner with web and user experience designers.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Required Qualifications:



  • 7 to 10 years of industry experience using Java, Spring, MVC, MySQL

  • Experience in public-facing front-end web development (HTML, CSS, JS, JSON, AJAX)

  • Experience with service oriented architecture and REST based web service development.

  • Experience with agile development methodologies

  • Excellent collaboration and team skills

  • Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent

  • Exhibit a strong passion for software development and customer delivery


Preferred Qualifications:



  • Experience with Grails or Rails

  • Experience with No SQL Database

description:
Who are we? 
Ticketmaster is the world's leading live event ticketing company selling over 400 million tickets each year, supporting 180,000 events and 12,000 clients in 19 countries worldwide.  At Ticketmaster, we power the people who create culture through live events, connecting more passionate fans to those experiences than anyone else.  We are innovators that embrace change and work hard to help others succeed.  We believe in open communication and stress accountability, because fans and clients count on us every day.  We strive for ease of use for our clients and fans while seeking out those who have a bias for action versus a desire for directives.   
  
Why Ticketmaster? 
A career at Ticketmaster will challenge and engage you. The pace here is fast, the atmosphere is fun and a passion for live events is a common thread that ties us together. As a global and growing business, we can truly offer a world of opportunities to expand your skills and develop your career.  Visit any of our offices and you'll find a diverse mix of passionate employees, helping fans around the globe connect with the artists, teams and events they love.  It truly is a unique and rewarding environment. 
  
The Role: 
Ticketmaster is looking for a Front-End Engineer to join our team. It’s an exciting opportunity to help evolve our product with next-generation web technologies. The candidate will be working with other Developers, Systems Engineers, as well as Product Managers, Designers, and Quality Assurance professionals. 
  
Responsibilities:

  • Develop and integrate front-end functionality for web applications
  • Understand and contribute existing codebase 
  • Proactively identify and solve technical problems
  • Implement challenging requirements
  • Contribute to the design and architecture of our code
  • Plan and prioritize work for large projects 


Qualifications:

  • 3+ years software front-end engineering experience (1+ years developing for a large system)
  • Experience building single page JavaScript applications
  • Outstanding front-end developer with basic back-end knowledge
  • Knows about current web standards and is really getting to know HTML5/CSS3
  • Excellent plain-old JavaScript skills, including prototyping, debugging, and optimization  
  • Good with Jquery (preferred) or other JavaScript library, AJAX, and the DOM.
  • Thorough knowledge of CSS, including cross-browser issues.
  • Can communicate and collaborate effectively with others (technical and non-technical).
  • Able to complete small-to-medium-scale projects involving other teams, with minimal guidance
  • Excellent troubleshooting skills 
  • Comfortable using GIT / SVN
  • Desire to learn new things 

  
Applicants for employment in the U.S. must possess work authorization which does not require sponsorship by the employer for a visa. 
  
EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY 
Ticketmaster strongly supports equal employment opportunity for all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by state or federal law. 
  
HIRING PRACTICES 
The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. 
  
Ticketmaster recruitment policies are designed to place the most highly qualified persons available in a timely and efficient manner. Ticketmaster may pursue all avenues available, including promotion from within, employee referrals, outside advertising, employment agencies, Internet recruiting, job fairs, college recruiting and search firms.
